propositions.text: The narrator and Fatty plan their next steps for information gathering.
Fatty will be responsible for preparing equipment.
The narrator will continue to collect information.
The narrator decides to investigate official channels to understand Zhang Qiling's background.
Previous investigations suggest Zhang Qiling might have participated in an archaeological team in the 1980s.
The narrator hopes to find clues in the old archives of a research institute in Changsha.
Accessing personnel archives is difficult due to secrecy and confidentiality.
The narrator identifies a potential research institute merged into a university.
The narrator contacts someone named Du Juanshan from the merged institute to gain access to the archives.
Du Juanshan agrees to take the narrator to the old archive room, located in the basement of the old lecture hall.
The archive room is described as a large, dark, and dusty warehouse filled with old file cabinets.
Du Juanshan informs the narrator that frequently used archives from 1995 onwards have been moved, leaving older, less frequently accessed files.
The narrator searches the archives from 1980 to 1985 for files related to West Sea archaeology.
No relevant files related to West Sea archaeology are found.
Du Juanshan suggests the archives might be in a confidential section or have been destroyed.
The narrator and Du Juanshan discover a locked door leading to an even older archive room from before the 1950s.
The lock on the door appears to have been cut and replaced with a seal.
The seal bears the date July 6, 1990, and the text 'XX University Archaeological Research Institute Seal'.
The narrator recognizes the handwriting on the seal as their own.
The narrator, accompanied by Wang Meng, returns to the university at night to investigate the sealed door.
The narrator confirms the handwriting on the seal is indeed their own, causing confusion and distress.
The narrator hypothesizes that another 'self' from the past might have been involved with the research institute.
The narrator decides to break into the sealed archive room.
Inside the room, they find a storage area filled with old furniture and boxes, not an archive.
They discover a large box that, when moved, reveals several piles of old archives.
The archives are damaged by rats and covered in dust.
Wang Meng notices neatly stacked files that appear to have been used as a makeshift stool.
The narrator, using their knowledge of organizing documents, deduces that a person was reading here and likely used another pile of files as a table.
The narrator finds a form titled 'Allowance Table for External Personnel of Shangsi Zhangjiapu Site Archaeological Project, Guangxi'.
Among the files, the narrator finds a hand-drawn plan identified as a 'Yangshi Lei' (样式雷) architectural drawing.
The drawing depicts a large courtyard house, possibly from the Qing Dynasty.
The narrator realizes the house is designed as a 'dark room,' with intentionally limited sunlight, suggesting the inhabitants could not tolerate light.
The narrator consults an elder acquaintance, Zheng Fuzhong, who confirms the unusual design of the house.
Zheng Fuzhong suggests the design might be related to 'Yizhuang' (义庄 - ancestral halls for the deceased) but dismisses the idea due to the scale of the house.
Two brokers, Ruan and Fang, approach the narrator to buy the 'Yangshi Lei' drawing at a high price.
The narrator recognizes Ruan's calloused fingers as indicative of someone who has handled coffins, suggesting a connection to grave robbing.
The narrator refuses to sell the drawing, but suggests meeting with the buyer.
The buyer is revealed to be a mysterious and influential woman named Huo Laotai, also known as 'Huo Xiangu' (霍仙姑).
Zheng Fuzhong provides the narrator with a calling card to arrange a meeting with Huo Xiangu.
The narrator, after consulting with Zheng Fuzhong, decides to enlist Fatty's help for the meeting.
The narrator and Fatty meet at the Xinyue Hotel in Beijing, and Zhang Qiling unexpectedly joins them.
The Xinyue Hotel is a renowned establishment for high-stakes antique dealings.
Inside the hotel, the narrator encounters a familiar-looking man who also seems to recognize them.

concepts.name: 盗墓笔记
concepts.context: Title of the book series.

concepts.name: 邛笼石影
concepts.context: Title of the specific book.

concepts.name: 南派三叔
concepts.context: Author of the book.

concepts.name: 张起灵
concepts.context: Character whose background is being investigated.

concepts.name: 胖子
concepts.context: Companion of the narrator, responsible for equipment.

concepts.name: 杭州
concepts.context: City where the narrator returns to.

concepts.name: 长沙
concepts.context: City where the narrator investigates archives.

concepts.name: 考古队
concepts.context: Group the narrator believes Zhang Qiling was part of.

concepts.name: 档案
concepts.context: Documents being searched for clues.

concepts.name: 研究所
concepts.context: Institution where the narrator looks for archives.

concepts.name: 大学
concepts.context: Institution where the old research institute was merged.

concepts.name: 杜鹃山
concepts.context: Contact person at the research institute.

concepts.name: 西沙
concepts.context: Location of the archaeological project the narrator is looking for.

concepts.name: 封条
concepts.context: Seal found on the older archive room door.

concepts.name: 笔迹
concepts.context: Handwriting, specifically the narrator's own found on the seal.

concepts.name: 王盟
concepts.context: Companion of the narrator.

concepts.name: 样式雷
concepts.context: Family of imperial architects; a drawing by them is found.

concepts.name: 暗房
concepts.context: Type of room designed to avoid sunlight.

concepts.name: 郑福中
concepts.context: Elder acquaintance of the narrator.

concepts.name: 掮客
concepts.context: Brokers who want to buy the drawing.

concepts.name: 霍仙姑
concepts.context: Mysterious and influential woman who wants to buy the drawing.

concepts.name: 新月饭店
concepts.context: Location of the meeting with Huo Xiangu.

concepts.name: 吴老狗
concepts.context: Narrator's grandfather, with a rumored connection to Huo Xiangu.

main_topics: Discovery of a mysterious historical document
Encounter with influential figures in the antique world
hierarchy.structure: The document follows a chronological narrative of the narrator's investigation. It begins with planning, moves to archival research, then a surprising discovery of personal connection to historical records, leading to the pursuit of valuable artifacts and an introduction to a complex social network.
